content.question: In the middle of the passage, Lydgate’s reaction to Farebrother’s domestic situation (“Lydgate had not expected to see so quaint a group: knowing simply that Mr. Farebrother was a bachelor, he had thought of being ushered into a snuggery where the chief furniture would probably be books and collections of natural objects”) reveals that

choices.label: Farebrother is not likely to remain in Lydgate’s favor
Farebrother will need to explain his home life to Lydgate
Farebrother does not fit Lydgate’s notion of a bachelor
Lydgate has unrealistic hopes for his personal friendships

content.answer: Farebrother does not fit Lydgate’s notion of a bachelor

skill.text: Skill 2.C: Describe the relationship between a character and a setting.
